@porunov In light of the discussion on the dev list today I wanted to check if you still have any need to open up the Repeat step? Our next release is coming up soon, I would like to either get this merged or closed before then.

Going to close this PR based on the discussion on the dev list.
https://lists.apache.org/thread/vjbjh29kwjhd5lcmkqqqqrhw7rw2ynh9

Additional steps can be opened up in the future but will be handled on a case by case basis. See dev list discussion for more details.
Looks like web-vitals is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.
Looks like @types/jest is up-to-date now, so this is no longer needed.

> @porunov In light of the discussion on the dev list today I wanted to check if you still have any need to open up the Repeat step? Our next release is coming up soon, I would like to either get this merged or closed before then.

I think we don't need it just yet as we were able to resolve it differently as for now, but it could be that we will need to open this step and / or other steps later if we decide to work on better parallelism. That said, as for now I think we should close this PR and open it when it's needed.  

That said, we do need to open a `LabelStep`. It would be great if we can merge #2097 before the release.

I believe I've addressed all existing comments so far. 

Concat with inject is now updated to the expected behaviour:
```
gremlin> g.inject('a', 'b', 'c').concat(__.inject('1', '2'))
==>a1
==>b2
==>c
gremlin> g.inject('a', 'b').concat(__.inject('1', '2', '3'))
==>a1
==>b2
```
Similarly for child traversals, reverted to iterating only the first result:
```
gremlin> g.inject('hello', 'hi').concat(__.V().values('name'))
==>hellomarko
==>himarko
```

> also, should concat(Traversal) be concat(Traversal...) to match the String form? this way you could concat(select('a'), select('b'), select('c')) which would match its String overload?

After some thought around this, I think maybe we should not implement `concat(Traversal…)` at this point, to lessen the complexity of `concat()`.
It’s also currently achievable by chaining `concat()`:
```
gremlin> g.V().as('a').out().as('b').out().as('c').constant("").concat(select("a").label()).concat(select("b").label()).concat(select("c").label())
==>personpersonsoftware
==>personpersonsoftware
```
However, I do want to explore this avenue a bit, so if it leads somewhere I will update here or on the dev list.

Closing this for now as https://github.com/neo4j-contrib/neo4j-tinkerpop-api-impl/tree/3.4 is pinned to neo4j 3.4.11 and no longer maintained. This should be reopened at a later date if maintenance of neo4j-tinkerpop-api-impl is resumed.

Hi Itay,

Thanks for all the rapid changes to the PR. To build off of Valentyn’s comments once again, I think there are still additional types that will need to be supported in order for the translator to be considered complete. Support for the following will all be needed:

- Translation of nested structures (within lists and maps)
- Primitive types (Char, Byte/int8, Short/int16)
- More common structure types (Date, Datetime, UUID, BigInteger, BigDecimal)
- Strategies

The [python translator](https://github.com/apache/tinkerpop/blob/master/gremlin-python/src/main/python/gremlin_python/process/translator.py) is a good reference to follow for this.
There is still an opportunity for this to be merged tomorrow morning (Thursday in the Americas) if its complete although the release process is already well underway so this would be the final chance to make it into the upcoming release. If there is only minor tweaks needed tomorrow morning we may be able to assist with getting it finished up and into the release.

Thanks,

Cole
